00048 /*****************************************************************************\
00049  *      File: l_softpipe_info.h
00050  *      Description: Structures and external function declarations for
00051  *                   modulo scheduler
00052  *      Creation Date: January, 1994
00053  *      Author: Daniel Lavery
00054  *
00055  *      Revision Date: Summer 1999
00056  *      Authors: IMPACT Technologies: Matthew Merten and John Gyllenhaal

00059 #ifndef L_SOFTPIPE_INFO_H
00060 #define L_SOFTPIPE_INFO_H
00061 
00062 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00063 #include <config.h>
00064 #include <Lcode/l_code.h>
00065 
00066 /* Info about a loop variant.  One of these is pointed to by the
00067    Softpipe_Op_Info structure for each destination register in the
00068    instruction (except those destination registers that are being
00069    redefined.  All uses of the loop variant point to a Src_MVE_Info
00070    structure which in turn points to the Lpipe_LRInfo associated
00071    with the variant.  There is only one of these for each loop
00072    variant.  Multiple definitions of the same variant all point to the
00073    same structure. */
00074 
00075 typedef struct _Lpipe_LRInfo {
00076   SM_Reg_Info *rinfo;
00077   SM_Oper *def_sm_oper;          /* pointer to sm oper that is the reference
00078                                     definition for the variant */
00079   int lifetime;                  /* lifetime of variant in cycles */
00080   int first_def_time;            /* issue time of the oper that first defined 
00081                                     the variant */
00082   int first_def_slot;            /* issue slot of oper that first defined
00083                                     the variant */
00084   int live_in_def_time;          /* live_in def time relative to the
00085                                     reference def (def_time). */
00086   int last_access_time;          /* issue time of the oper that last used
00087                                     or defined the variant */
00088   int last_access_slot;          /* issue slot of oper that last used
00089                                     or defined the variant */
00090   int num_names;                 /* number of unique names for MVE.
00091                                     for rot regs, this the number of
00092                                     names needed in the kernel, plus 1 for
00093                                     the original name in names[0]. */
00094 
00095   int num_names_w_pro;
00096   L_Operand **names;             /* array of pointers to L_Operands to
00097                                     be copied when renaming for MVE.  
00098                                     names[0] points to a copy of the 
00099                                     original name for the variant */
00100   unsigned int use_after_def_slot:1; 
00101                                  /* flag to indicate that the last use of 
00102                                     this variant is scheduled in a higher
00103                                     numbered slot than the definition of
00104                                     the variant. */
00105   unsigned int live_out:1;       /* flag to indicate if variant is live out
00106                                     of loop */
00107   unsigned int live_in:1;        /* flag to indicate if the range is live in */
00108   unsigned int prologue_mov_inserted:1;
00109                                  /* flag to indicate if a move instruction
00110                                     has been inserted before prologue to
00111                                     fix up live in value.  Currently not
00112                                     used.  */
00113 } Lpipe_LRInfo;
00114 
00115 /* Info about the use of each loop variant.  One of these is attached
00116    to the Softpipe_Op_Info structure for each source register that
00117    uses the variant. */
00118 
00119 typedef struct _Lpipe_MVEInfo {
00120   struct _Lpipe_LRInfo *live_range; /* pointer to the
00121                                           Lpipe_LRInfo associated
00122                                           with the variant */
00123   int lifetime;         /* lifetime from the reference definition of
00124                                    the variant to this particular use */
00125   int stage_lifetime_incr;      /* flag to indicate that stage lifetime
00126                                    needs to be rounded up during renaming */
00127 } Lpipe_MVEInfo;
00128 
00129 /* This structure is attached to each oper in the original loop body and
00130    contains all the info (or pointers to it) needed for scheduling and MVE */
00131 
00132 typedef struct _Softpipe_Op_Info {
00133   /* First pass: information gathering. */
00134   int home_block;               /* Basic block in the cb in which
00135                                    this oper resided before modulo
00136                                    scheduling */
00137   L_Cb *exit_cb;                /* cb to which control flows on exit
00138                                    for branches (only for branches) */
00139   double exit_weight;           /* weight of the exit flow for 
00140                                    branches (only for branches) */
00141   /* Post-scheduling. */
00142   int intra_iter_issue_time;    /* issue time within a single
00143                                    iteration */
00144   int issue_time;               /* During scheduling, this is the same
00145                                    as the intra_iter_issue_time below.
00146                                    During unrolling and code schema
00147                                    generation, this is the issue time of
00148                                    the oper within its cb.  Can be used
00149                                    for scheduler estimates for execution
00150                                    time. */
00151   int issue_slot;
00152   int stage;                    /* The number of the intra-iteration 
00153                                    stage that the oper is in.  Intra-
00154                                    iteration stages are numbered 0 to
00155                                    stage_count-1. */
00156   /* MVE */
00157   int kernel_copy;              /* If oper is in the kernel, this is the 
00158                                    copy of the kernel which contains
00159                                    this oper.  The kernel copies are
00160                                    numbered 0 to unroll-1.  If oper is in 
00161                                    prologue or epilogue, this is the copy 
00162                                    of the kernel which the oper was 
00163                                    copied from. */
00164   Lpipe_MVEInfo **src_mve_info;    /* pointer to array of pointers
00165                                       to Lpipe_MVEInfo structures */
00166   Lpipe_MVEInfo **pred_mve_info;   /* pointer to array of pointers
00167                                       to Lpipe_MVEInfo structures */
00168   Lpipe_MVEInfo **dest_mve_info;   /* pointer to array of pointers
00169                                       to Lpipe_MVEInfo structures */
00170 
00171   List isrc_mve_info;              /* List of implicit src MVE info */
00172 
00173   /* Gen Epi-/Pro-logues */
00174   int prologue_stage;              /* The number of the prologue
00175                                       stage that the oper is in. Prologue
00176                                       stages are numbered 0 to
00177                                       stage_count-2. */
00178   int epilogue_stage;              /* The number of the epilogue stage
00179                                       that the oper is in.  Epilogue
00180                                       stages are numbered 0 to
00181                                       stage_count-theta-1.  Epilogue
00182                                       stage 0 is for the opers remaining
00183                                       in same kernel copy as the exit
00184                                       branch. */
00185   int unrolled_iter_num;           /* Unique id for each copy of
00186                                       the unrolled kernel in a
00187                                       prologue or epilogue.  Used
00188                                       for maintaining sync arcs for
00189                                       prologue and epilogues. */
00190   /* Scheduler-specific fields */
00191   /* set by Lpipe_compute_slack_time_using_MinDist */
00192   int estart;                      /* earliest start time for priority */
00193   int lstart;                      /* latest start time for priority */
00194   int slack;                       /* lstart - estart for priority */
00195   /* set by Lpipe_compute_static_priorities */
00196   int priority;                    /* scheduling priority */
00197   /* set by Lpipe_compute_ready_time based on scheduled ops */
00198   int ready_time;                  /* time when all dependences will be
00199                                       satisfied */
00200 
00201   /* flags */
00202 
00203   unsigned int loop_back_br:1;     /* BOOL: op is the loopback branch 
00204                                     *   or a copy thereof. */
00205   unsigned int branch_path_node:1; /* BOOL: op on which the loopback branch
00206                                     * depends */
00207   unsigned int scheduled:1;        /* BOOL: op has been scheduled */
00208 
00209 } Softpipe_Op_Info;
00210 
00211 extern L_Alloc_Pool *Softpipe_Op_Info_pool;
00212 
00213 extern Softpipe_Op_Info *Lpipe_create_op_info ();
00214 extern void Lpipe_init_op_info (SM_Oper *, int, int);
00215 extern void Lpipe_construct_op_info (SM_Cb *, SM_Oper *, int *, int *);
00216 extern Softpipe_Op_Info *Lpipe_copy_op_info (Softpipe_Op_Info *);
00217 extern void Lpipe_free_op_info (L_Cb *);
00218 /* 20030110 SZU
00219  * Added to free for just one op; used in start_stop nodes
00220  */
00221 extern void Lpipe_free_oper_op_info (L_Oper *);
00222 extern void Lpipe_print_op_info (SM_Oper *);
00223 
00224 extern void Lpipe_print_cb_info (SM_Cb *);
00225 
00226 extern void Lpipe_copy_sched_info (SM_Cb *);
00227 
00228 #endif
